meanings.definition: The group of spectators or listeners at a public event.
meanings.sent1: The audiences clapped and cheered at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The theater had a full house with eager audiences.
meanings.sent3: The audiences were so engrossed in the play that they forgot to eat their popcorn.
meanings.sent4: The speaker's words resonated deeply with the audiences, touching their hearts.
meanings.sent5: The diverse audiences brought a vibrant energy to the stadium.

meanings.definition: The readership of a book, magazine, or newspaper.
meanings.sent1: The magazine attracted a large audiences with its captivating articles.
meanings.sent2: The author's new book gained popularity among different audiences.
meanings.sent3: The audiences were so hooked on the novel that they stayed up all night reading.
meanings.sent4: The newspaper's bold headlines grabbed the attention of audiences everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The diverse audiences enjoyed exploring various genres of literature.

meanings.definition: The group of people reached by a television or radio broadcast.
meanings.sent1: The TV show entertained audiences of all ages.
meanings.sent2: The radio program attracted large audiences with its music selection.
meanings.sent3: The audiences were glued to their screens during the live broadcast.
meanings.sent4: The news anchor's report captivated audiences across the nation.
meanings.sent5: The interactive game show engaged audiences in a fun and exciting way.
